back_cards.definition_en: A person who gives blood or an organ for medical use
back_cards.example_en: The hospital thanked the donor for saving a patient's life with their blood donation.

back_cards.definition_en: Someone who contributes money to a cause
back_cards.example_en: The museum was funded by a generous donor who loved art.
The library received books from a donor to expand its collection.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who provides genetic material, like sperm or eggs
back_cards.example_en: The couple met with a donor to discuss fertility options.

back_cards.definition_en: An entity giving resources for a project
back_cards.example_en: The school's new playground was built thanks to a corporate donor.
She gradually improved her English by practicing every day.
The sun gradually set behind the mountain, casting a warm glow.
His confidence gradually increased as he gained more experience.
The company gradually expanded its operations to new cities.

back_cards.definition_en: Occurring in a slow, subtle way
back_cards.example_en: The room gradually filled with guests as the party began.
She overlooked a typo in the report before sending it.

back_cards.definition_en: To have a view over a place from above
back_cards.example_en: The hotel room overlooks the ocean, offering a stunning view.
He chose to overlook her mistake and focus on her efforts.

back_cards.definition_en: To miss something due to inattention
back_cards.example_en: The manager overlooked an important email in his inbox.
She was hired to overlook the construction of the new building.

back_cards.definition_en: A fixture for sanitation in a bathroom
back_cards.example_en: The plumber fixed the leaking toilet in the house.
The restaurant's toilet was clean and well-maintained.
The campsite had a portable toilet for visitors.

back_cards.definition_en: A facility used for personal hygiene
back_cards.example_en: She excused herself to use the toilet during the meeting.
The village installed new toilets to improve public health.
She was pleased with her exam results.
He felt pleased after finishing the project on time.
The teacher was pleased with the students' progress.
They were pleased to hear the event was a success.
She was pleased to meet her new neighbor.

back_cards.definition_en: To look similar to someone or something
back_cards.example_en: The child resembles her mother in appearance.
This painting resembles a famous artwork from the Renaissance.
His handwriting resembles his brother's neat style.
The new phone design resembles the older model.
Her voice resembles a singer's with its clear tone.

back_cards.definition_en: A set of beliefs or principles
back_cards.example_en: The politician's ideology shaped their policies on education.

back_cards.definition_en: A system of ideas guiding a group
back_cards.example_en: The movement was driven by a shared ideology of equality.
His ideology clashed with the company's values.
The artist's work reflected a modernist ideology.
The debate focused on competing ideologies in economics.
The athlete basked in the glory of winning the championship.
The sunset's glory painted the sky with vibrant colors.
The author received glory for her bestselling novel.
The team fought for the glory of their school.
The festival was a glory to the town's cultural heritage.

back_cards.definition_en: The highest possible amount or degree
back_cards.example_en: The elevator can hold a maximum of ten people.
She worked to her maximum capacity to finish the task.
The car reached a maximum speed of 120 miles per hour.
The project required a maximum effort from the team.
The store set a maximum purchase limit during the sale.

back_cards.definition_en: A part of the body with a specific function
back_cards.example_en: The heart is a vital organ that pumps blood.

back_cards.definition_en: A musical instrument with pipes or keyboards
back_cards.example_en: The church's organ played a beautiful hymn.
The plant's leaves are considered its primary organ for photosynthesis.

back_cards.definition_en: A medium of communication, like a publication
back_cards.example_en: The magazine was the official organ of the association.
The council acted as the decision-making organ of the group.
She loves to skip rope in the park.
He decided to skip the meeting to finish his work.

back_cards.definition_en: To move quickly with small jumps
back_cards.example_en: The child skipped happily down the street.

back_cards.definition_en: To avoid or not do something
back_cards.example_en: She skipped breakfast to catch the early bus.
He skipped the boring parts of the book.
The starting point of the race was at the park.
Her starting salary at the job was competitive.
The starting whistle signaled the beginning of the game.
The starting lineup for the team was announced.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicating the launch of an event
back_cards.example_en: The starting time for the concert was 7 PM.

back_cards.definition_en: A tool with bristles for cleaning or grooming
back_cards.example_en: She used a brush to clean her shoes.

back_cards.definition_en: A light touch or brief encounter
back_cards.example_en: His brush with fame came after the viral video.
The artist picked up a brush to start the canvas.

back_cards.definition_en: Vegetation like shrubs or small trees
back_cards.example_en: The hikers walked through dense brush in the forest.
Her brush with the law taught her a lesson.

back_cards.definition_en: A rectangular block used in construction
back_cards.example_en: The house was built with red brick.
He's a brick, always helping when I need him.

back_cards.definition_en: A block of material, like clay
back_cards.example_en: The pathway was paved with smooth bricks.

back_cards.definition_en: A heavy object used as a weight
back_cards.example_en: She used a brick to hold the door open.
The wall collapsed because one brick was loose.
He felt a pain in his gut after eating too much.
Her gut told her something was wrong.
The mechanic inspected the gut of the machine.
It took gut to stand up to the challenge.
The gut of the story was about perseverance.

back_cards.definition_en: A booking for a service or place
back_cards.example_en: She made a reservation at the restaurant for dinner.
He had reservations about joining the risky project.

back_cards.definition_en: A designated area for a group
back_cards.example_en: The tribe lived on a reservation in the west.
They confirmed their hotel reservation for the trip.
She agreed to help, but with some reservations.
The rebel fought against the government's rules.
She was a rebel, always challenging old customs.

back_cards.definition_en: A fighter in a resistance movement
back_cards.example_en: The rebels hid in the mountains to plan their attack.
He was known as the rebel of the art world.
The young rebel ignored the school's strict dress code.
She was disappointed when the concert was canceled.
He felt disappointed with his low test score.

back_cards.definition_en: Showing mild sadness over an outcome
back_cards.example_en: The team was disappointed after losing the game.
She was disappointed that her plan didn't work.
He was disappointed to miss the job opportunity.
The old oak in the park was over 100 years old.
The table was made of solid oak.
The oak stood tall through the storm.

back_cards.definition_en: A species in a forest ecosystem
back_cards.example_en: The oak provided shade for the animals below.
They chose oak for the new bookshelves.
Her passport was still valid for travel.
His argument was valid and convinced the team.
The coupon is valid only until tomorrow.
Her point about the budget was valid.
The contract remained valid after review.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who teaches a skill or subject
back_cards.example_en: The driving instructor was patient with new students.

back_cards.definition_en: A teacher in a specific field
back_cards.example_en: The yoga instructor led the class through poses.
The instructor explained the math problem clearly.
She was an instructor at the community college.
The ski instructor helped the kids learn to turn.
The firefighter rescued the cat from the burning house.
She rescued her phone from the bottom of the pool.
The lifeguard rescued the swimmer from the rough waves.

back_cards.definition_en: To deliver from a bad situation
back_cards.example_en: He rescued the project by finding new funding.
The team worked to rescue the trapped hikers.
The community held a meeting to address racism.
Racism in hiring practices was exposed by the report.
His comments revealed a deep-seated racism.
The policy was criticized for perpetuating racism.
The school taught students about the harm of racism.
She received a pension after working for 30 years.
His pension allowed him to travel in retirement.

back_cards.definition_en: A financial plan for old age
back_cards.example_en: The company offered a generous pension plan.
The government increased pensions for veterans.
Her pension ensured a comfortable lifestyle.
He manages his diabetes with daily medication.
The doctor explained how diabetes affects the body.
She was diagnosed with diabetes at a young age.
Diabetes can lead to serious health complications.
He adjusted his diet to control his diabetes.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of similar things close together
back_cards.example_en: A cluster of stars shone brightly in the night sky.

back_cards.definition_en: A collection of items in one place
back_cards.example_en: The market had a cluster of fruit stalls.
She found a cluster of mushrooms in the forest.

back_cards.definition_en: A grouping in data or analysis
back_cards.example_en: The study identified a cluster of cases in one area.
A cluster of houses sat on the hillside.
She was eager to start her new job.
The kids were eager to open their presents.
He was eager to learn how to play the guitar.
The team was eager for the championship game.
She was eager to prove her skills in the competition.

back_cards.definition_en: A plant used for recreational or medicinal purposes
back_cards.example_en: Marijuana is legal for medical use in some states.
He studied the effects of marijuana on health.
Some people use marijuana to relieve stress.
The store sold marijuana under strict laws.
Marijuana is often debated in public policy.
The soldiers were trained for combat in the field.
She joined the combat against climate change.
He received a medal for his bravery in combat.
The movie depicted intense combat scenes.
The team worked in combat against poverty.
She received praise for her excellent presentation.
The teacher gave praise to the hardworking student.
His artwork earned high praise at the exhibition.
The coach's praise boosted the team's morale.
Her boss offered praise for her dedication.

back_cards.definition_en: Clothing worn for a specific occasion
back_cards.example_en: She wore a witch costume for Halloween.
The actor's costume was perfect for the play.

back_cards.definition_en: A set of clothes representing a theme
back_cards.example_en: His pirate costume was a hit at the party.
The museum staff wore colonial costumes.
The costume made her unrecognizable at the event.
She finished in sixth place in the race.

back_cards.definition_en: Referring to the number six in order
back_cards.example_en: The sixth chapter of the book was the most exciting.
He was the sixth person to arrive at the meeting.
The sixth grade students went on a field trip.
Her sixth attempt at the puzzle was successful.
He makes frequent visits to the library.
Frequent rain showers kept the streets wet.
Her frequent complaints annoyed the team.
Frequent delays caused frustration at the airport.
The store sees frequent customers every morning.
The sunset was her inspiration for the painting.
He found inspiration for his novel in a dream.
Her teacher was an inspiration to all the students.
The music provided inspiration for her dance routine.
His speech was an inspiration to the volunteers.
The foundation was made of solid concrete.
They poured concrete to create the new sidewalk.
The plan needed concrete steps to succeed.
The bridge was reinforced with strong concrete.

back_cards.definition_en: A surface for roads or floors
back_cards.example_en: The garage floor was made of polished concrete.
She enjoys cooking Italian meals for her family.
Cooking on the grill gives the meat a smoky flavor.
His cooking reflects his grandmother's recipes.
Cooking is a relaxing hobby for her.
The chef's cooking impressed the restaurant guests.

back_cards.definition_en: A secret plan to do something harmful
back_cards.example_en: The group was accused of a conspiracy to commit fraud.
The movie was about a political conspiracy.
Rumors of a conspiracy spread through the town.
The court investigated the conspiracy behind the crime.
She didn't believe in the conspiracy about the election.
Her kindness is a trait everyone admires.
His stubborn trait made teamwork difficult.
Blue eyes are a common trait in her family.
The dog's loyalty is a well-known trait of the breed.
Her creativity is a trait that shines in her work.

back_cards.definition_en: A vehicle for transporting goods or people
back_cards.example_en: The delivery van arrived with the packages.
The family took a van for their road trip.
The team rode in a van to the game.
The plumber's van was parked outside the house.
The van carried tools for the construction crew.
The institutional policies were updated annually.

back_cards.definition_en: Connected to a system or structure
back_cards.example_en: Institutional changes improved the school's efficiency.
The hospital had an institutional approach to care.
Institutional reforms were needed in the government.
The company faced institutional challenges during growth.

back_cards.definition_en: A plant used as a seasoning
back_cards.example_en: She added garlic to the soup for extra flavor.
The recipe called for two cloves of garlic.
Garlic gave the pasta sauce a rich taste.
He ate garlic to boost his immune system.
The chef used fresh garlic in the dish.
Drinking enough water is important for health.
His drinking at the party got out of control.
She was drinking coffee while reading a book.
Drinking juice is part of her morning routine.
The group enjoyed drinking together at the bar.
The chandelier was made of sparkling crystal.
She admired the crystal vase on the table.

back_cards.definition_en: A substance with a regular structure
back_cards.example_en: The scientist studied the crystal under a microscope.
The crystal pendant shone in the sunlight.
Her necklace featured a large crystal.
He's a pro at fixing computers.
The golfer played like a pro in the tournament.
She hired a pro to design her website.
The pro handled the project with ease.
The chef was a pro at creating desserts.
The helicopter landed on the hospital roof.
They took a helicopter to the remote island.
The helicopter airlifted the injured hiker.
The news team used a helicopter to film the event.
The CEO arrived by helicopter for the meeting.
She sought counsel from her mentor before deciding.
The counsel presented a strong case in court.
His counsel helped the team navigate the crisis.
The elder's counsel was valued in the community.
The company hired a counsel for legal matters.
She solved the equation in her math class.
The equation described the motion of the planet.
The chemist used an equation to predict the reaction.
The equation was key to understanding the data.

back_cards.definition_en: A method to solve a problem
back_cards.example_en: He worked through the equation step by step.
The museum displayed Roman artifacts.
The Roman architecture inspired the building's design.
She studied Roman history in school.
The clock used Roman numerals for the hours.
The Roman style influenced modern law.
The software had a sophisticated design.
She had a sophisticated taste in fashion.
The robot used sophisticated sensors to navigate.
The party was a sophisticated event with live music.
His argument was sophisticated and well-researched.

back_cards.definition_en: The choice of when something happens
back_cards.example_en: Her timing for the joke was perfect.

back_cards.definition_en: The pace or rhythm of an action
back_cards.example_en: The dancer's timing matched the music perfectly.
The timing of the meeting suited everyone.

back_cards.definition_en: The control of speed or sequence
back_cards.example_en: Good timing is key in a successful presentation.
The timing of the sale boosted profits.
